LayoutNode.Content: Jennifer Neville
LayoutNode.SRC: Jennifer Neville

LayoutNode.Content: Home Research Publications Lab Teaching CV
LayoutNode.SRC: HomeResearchPublicationsLabTeachingCV

LayoutNode.Content: Associate Professor and Miller Family Chair of Computer Science and Statistics at Purdue University .
LayoutNode.SRC: Associate Professor and Miller Family Chair of Computer Science and Statistics at Purdue University.

LayoutNode.Content: My research interests lie in the fields of machine learning and data mining. In particular, I focus on the development and analysis of algorithms for relationaldomains, including social, information, and communication networks, as well as physical networks and distributed systems. My work can be broadlycategorized into: (1) design and implementation of machine learning and data mining techniques, (2) discovery of, and adjustment for, statistical biases dueto networks data characteristics, and (3) application to real-world tasks.
LayoutNode.SRC: My research interests lie in the fields of machine learning and data mining. In particular, I focus on the development and analysis of algorithms for relational domains, including social, information, and communication networks, as well as physical networks and distributed systems. My work can be broadly categorized into: (1) design and implementation of machine learning and data mining techniques, (2) discovery of, and adjustment for, statistical biases due to networks data characteristics, and (3) application to real-world tasks.
